title: Authors and Citation
text: Mike O'Brien. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: O'Brien M (2023). matos: Interface Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS). R package version 0.1.1, https://github.com/mhpob/matos.
code: @Manual{,   title = {matos: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)},   author = {Mike O'Brien},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://github.com/mhpob/matos}, }

what: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: {matos} attempt API Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System website, powered suite httr rvest functions. , ’s necessarily fast best way things – ’re just pinging website back forth. Additionally, internet connection needed pretty much anything work. Please note need MATOS account, can sign , order interface project-specific files.

title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: get_updates: new function download files updated since given date. Super useful data push! list_files now since argument, allowing list files updated since certain date.

title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: package still “throw things wall see sticks” phase (“package currently undergoing heavy development”). can install ---date version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("mhpob/matos")

title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: First, matos_projects returns project page, useful figure URLs associated project. need MATOS permissions order view page. can also view files ’ve uploaded projects using list_files, requires logging first. can also list OTN node Data Extraction Files.
code: library(matos) #> By continuing, you are agreeing to the ACT Network MATOS User Agreement and Data Policy, Version 1.1: #>  #> https://matos.asascience.com/static/MATOS.User.Agreement.V1.1.pdf  all_projects <- matos_projects()  head(all_projects) #>                                      name number #> 1                               ack array    168 #> 2     apg atlantic and shortnose sturgeon    176 #> 3 boem-de offshore wind energy area study     85 #> 4                         brandywine shad    162 #> 5      btwaves caribbean acoustic tagging     94 #> 6                    cfcc marine tech cfr     98 #>                                               url #> 1 https://matos.asascience.com/project/detail/168 #> 2 https://matos.asascience.com/project/detail/176 #> 3  https://matos.asascience.com/project/detail/85 #> 4 https://matos.asascience.com/project/detail/162 #> 5  https://matos.asascience.com/project/detail/94 #> 6  https://matos.asascience.com/project/detail/98 project_files <- list_files(project = 'umces boem offshore wind energy', data_type = 'project') #> Please log in. #> Please enter password in TK window (Alt+Tab) #> Please enter password in TK window (Alt+Tab)  head(project_files) #>   project                                file_type upload_date #> 1      87 Deployed Receivers – Deployment Metadata  2020-03-30 #> 2      87               Tag Detections - .vfl file  2020-05-28 #> 3      87               Tag Detections - .vfl file  2020-05-28 #> 4      87               Tag Detections - .vfl file  2020-05-28 #> 5      87               Tag Detections - .vfl file  2020-05-28 #> 6      87               Tag Detections - .vfl file  2020-05-28 #>                      file_name #> 1 BOEM_metadata_deployment.xls #> 2  VR2AR_546455_20170328_1.vrl #> 3  VR2AR_546456_20170328_1.vrl #> 4  VR2AR_546457_20170329_1.vrl #> 5  VR2AR_546458_20170329_1.vrl #> 6  VR2AR_546459_20170328_1.vrl #>                                                      url #> 1  https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/375 #> 2 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/1810 #> 3 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/1811 #> 4 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/1812 #> 5 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/1813 #> 6 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/1814 ACT_MATOS_files <- list_files(project = 'umces boem offshore wind energy', data_type = 'extraction')  head(ACT_MATOS_files) #>   project            file_type detection_type detection_year upload_date #> 1      87 Data Extraction File        matched           2017  2021-11-23 #> 2      87 Data Extraction File        matched           2018  2021-08-17 #> 3      87 Data Extraction File        matched           2019  2021-08-17 #> 4      87 Data Extraction File        matched           2020  2021-11-23 #> 5      87 Data Extraction File        matched           2021  2021-08-17 #> 6      87 Data Extraction File      qualified           2016  2021-11-23 #>                              file_name #> 1   proj87_matched_detections_2017.zip #> 2   proj87_matched_detections_2018.zip #> 3   proj87_matched_detections_2019.zip #> 4   proj87_matched_detections_2020.zip #> 5   proj87_matched_detections_2021.zip #> 6 proj87_qualified_detections_2016.zip #>                                                                url #> 1 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/downloadExtraction/87_1 #> 2 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/downloadExtraction/87_2 #> 3 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/downloadExtraction/87_3 #> 4 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/downloadExtraction/87_4 #> 5 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/downloadExtraction/87_5 #> 6 https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/downloadExtraction/87_6

what: Download project or data extraction files
title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: ways download different types files held MATOS. can download directly know URL file: can download using index ACT_MATOS_files table , file second row. Note means specify kind data ’re looking identifying index. download using file name, get_file use file extension figure kind data want, explicitly identifying data type needed. Since data extraction files zipped, function assumes correct data type.
code: project_files$url[1] #> [1] "https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/375"  get_file(url = project_files$url[1]) #> File saved to C:\Users\darpa2\Analysis\matos\BOEM_metadata_deployment.xls get_file(file = 2, project = 'umces boem offshore wind energy', data_type = 'extraction') #> File saved to C:\Users\darpa2\Analysis\matos\proj87_matched_detections_2018.zip #> File unzipped to C:/Users/darpa2/Analysis/matos/proj87_matched_detections_2018.csv C:/Users/darpa2/Analysis/matos/data_description.txt get_file(file = 'proj87_matched_detections_2018.zip',          project = 'umces boem offshore wind energy',          overwrite = T) #> File saved to C:\Users\darpa2\Analysis\matos\proj87_matched_detections_2018.zip #> File unzipped to C:/Users/darpa2/Analysis/matos/proj87_matched_detections_2018.csv C:/Users/darpa2/Analysis/matos/data_description.txt

title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: Using tag_search function, can interface MATOS’ tag search page. careful function – can take , long time return files. function downloads requested CSV working directory, , import = T used, reads R session.
code: my_detections <- tag_search(tags = paste0('A69-1601-254', seq(60, 90, 1)),                             start_date = '03/01/2016',                             end_date = '04/01/2016',                              import = T)

title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: times want upload new data MATOS. currently accepted data types formats : newly-deployed transmitters (CSV/XLS(X)) detection logs (CSV/VRL) receiver glider deployment metadata (CSV/XLS(X)) receiver events like temperature, tilt, etc. (CSV) glider GPS tracks (CSV) data types use designated Ocean Tracking Network templates: tag metadata receiver deployment metadata glider deployment metadata don’t one templates downloaded, can download package. example: , get uploading!
code: get_otn_template('glider') post_file(project = 'umces boem offshore wind energy',           file = c('this_is_a_dummy_file.csv', 'so_is_this.csv'),           data_type = 'new_tags')

title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: noted , package undergoing ton development. ’s something missed, please open issue GitHub email (Mike O’Brien: obrien@umces.edu) directly.

title: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS)
text: Sessions expire -frequently like. , may often prompted log . Just follow instructions crunch away.

what: Download files from the MATOS website — get_file
title: Download files from the MATOS website — get_file
text: get_file downloads files MATOS website. best-used conjunction list_files.

title: Download files from the MATOS website — get_file
code: get_file(   file = NULL,   project = NULL,   data_type = c(NA, "extraction", "project"),   url = NULL,   out_dir = getwd(),   overwrite = F,   to_vue = F )

title: Download files from the MATOS website — get_file
text: file character vector listing name file, numeric listing index found list_files. project character vector listing full name project, numeric listing project number. data_type one NA (default), "extraction", "project"; used call list_files hood. NA, try guess whether project files data extraction files desired file name. file index provided, guess throw error. "extraction" "project" provided, list data extraction project files, respectively. Partial matching allowed, repair correct argument spaces words "data"/"file(s)" included. url URL file downloaded. out_dir Character. directory/folder want file saved ? Default current working directory. overwrite Logical. want file name overwritten? Passed httr::write_disk. to_vue Logical. Convert VUE export format?

title: Download files from the MATOS website — get_file
code: if (FALSE) { # If you know the direct URL to your file, you don't need the file or project names: get_file(url = 'https://matos.asascience.com/projectfile/download/327')  # If you know the file name and your project ID (name or number), provide both. # This will guess that you want the data extraction file since the file name # ends in .zip. get_file(file = 'proj87_matched_detections_2017.zip',         'UMCES BOEM Offshore Wind Energy')  # This won't work, as it can't guess whether you want project or data extraction #  files from the number "1". get_file(1, 87)  # Need to provide a value to \code{data_type}. get_file(1, 87, data_type = 'extraction') }

title: List personal MATOS projects — get_my_projects
text: function lists functions logged-user permissions.

title: List personal MATOS projects — get_my_projects
code: get_my_projects(read_access = T)

title: List personal MATOS projects — get_my_projects
text: read_access want list projects file-read permission? Defaults TRUE, though significant speed switched FALSE.

title: List personal MATOS projects — get_my_projects
code: if (FALSE) { # After logging in, just type the following: get_my_projects() }

title: Download Ocean-Tracking-Network-style metadata templates — get_otn_template
text: Download Ocean-Tracking-Network-style metadata templates

title: Download Ocean-Tracking-Network-style metadata templates — get_otn_template
code: get_otn_template(   template_type = c("tag", "receiver", "glider"),   dest_file = NULL )

title: Download Ocean-Tracking-Network-style metadata templates — get_otn_template
text: template_type Character string. One : "tag" (default), tagging data submittal template; "receiver", deployment data submittal template; "glider", wave Slocum glider metadata template. dest_file Optional character string noting like file downloaded. Defaults working directory original file name.

title: Download Ocean-Tracking-Network-style metadata templates — get_otn_template
text: Ocean Tracking Network metadata template XLSX format.

title: Download Ocean-Tracking-Network-style metadata templates — get_otn_template
code: if (FALSE) { # Tag metadata template downloaded to working directory get_otn_template()  # Glider metadata template downloaded to downloads folder get_otn_template('glider', 'c:/users/myusername/downloads/glider_metadata.xlsx') }

what: Download all data extraction files that were updated after a certain date — get_updates
title: Download all data extraction files that were updated after a certain date — get_updates
text: loop around get_file.

title: Download all data extraction files that were updated after a certain date — get_updates
code: get_updates(..., out_dir = getwd(), overwrite = F, to_vue = F)

title: Download all data extraction files that were updated after a certain date — get_updates
text: ... arguments list_files out_dir Character. directory/folder want file saved ? Default current working directory. Passed httr::write_disk via get_file. overwrite Logical. want file name overwritten? Passed httr::write_disk via get_file. since list download files uploaded date. Must YYYY-MM-DD format. Also passed list_files.

title: List MATOS project files — list_files
text: functions list file names, types, upload date, URLs MATOS project files -- basically everything see *Data Extraction Files* *Project Files* sections project page. project page, **need ** first log using matos_login.

title: List MATOS project files — list_files
code: list_files(   project = NULL,   data_type = c("extraction", "project"),   detection_type = c(NULL, "matched", "qualified", "sentinel_tag", "unqualified"),   since = NULL )

title: List MATOS project files — list_files
text: project Either project number (number project page URL) full name project (big name bold project page, ** "Project Title"). data_type one "extraction" (default), "project", list data extraction project files, respectively. Partial matching allowed, repair correct argument spaces words "data"/"file(s)" included. detection_type one NULL (default), "matched", "qualified", "sentinel_tag", "unqualified"; used call list_files hood. NULL, detection types listed. Partial matching allowed, repair correct argument spaces words "detection(s)" included. information data types can found OTN's website. since list files uploaded date. Optional, must YYYY-MM-DD format.

title: List MATOS project files — list_files
text: data frame columns "File.Name", "File.Type", "Upload.Date", "url".

title: List MATOS project files — list_files
text: detection_files project_files wrappers around web-scraping routine: 1) find project number provided, 2) download HTML table, 3) parse URL file, 4) combine table URLs data frame. functions useful investigating files available, downloading get_file. detection_files lists files associated ACT_MATOS OTN node. files listed *Data Extraction Files* page. project_files lists tag receiver metadata files uploaded user. files listed *Project Files* page.

title: List MATOS project files — list_files
code: if (FALSE) { # Select using project number, this defaults to grabbing the data extraction files list_files(87)  # Or, grab the project files list_files(project = 87, data_type = 'project')  # Select using project name list_files('umces boem offshore wind energy') }

what: matos: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS) — matos
title: matos: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS) — matos
text: package provides HTML-scaping functions interact MATOS website (https://matos.asascience.com/). Functions allow aggreation data downloading posting files.

title: matos: Interface with the Mid-Atlantic Acoustic Telemetry Observing System (MATOS) — matos
text: Maintainer: Mike O'Brien obrien@umces.edu

what: Log in to your MATOS account — matos_login
title: Log in to your MATOS account — matos_login
text: function prompts username (email) password associated MATOS account. necessary may interface project-specific files. MATOS account can sign one . Log completed using RStudio API; probably work using RStudio, changed future. pop appear asking username password. everything works , credentials kept sessions' cookies. username/password saved -- done intentionally accidentally save credentials public script.

title: Log in to your MATOS account — matos_login
code: matos_login()

title: Log in to your MATOS account — matos_login
code: if (FALSE) { # Type: matos_login() # ...then follow the on-screen prompts }

title: List MATOS projects — matos_projects
text: default, function scrapes table found https://matos.asascience.com/project. table provides full name project, also MATOS project number project page URL. need log via matos_login permissions view/download table.

title: List MATOS projects — matos_projects
code: matos_projects(what = c("all", "mine"), read_access = T)

title: List MATOS projects — matos_projects
text: list projects want returned: projects ("", default) projects ("mine")? read_access listing projects, want list projects file-read permission? Defaults TRUE, though significant speed switched FALSE.

title: List MATOS projects — matos_projects
code: if (FALSE) { # List all projects, the default: matos_projects()  # List your projects (which may contain some for which you do not have read access): matos_projects('mine', read_access = F) }

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Upload files to MATOS — post_file
text: function lets post files projects. need log uploading.

title: Upload files to MATOS — post_file
code: post_file(   project,   file,   data_type = c("new_tags", "receivers", "detections", "events", "gps", "glider"),   print_response = F )

title: Upload files to MATOS — post_file
text: project name (character) number (numeric) project wish post file. file file(s) wish upload. file located working directory, can just filename extension. need provide full file location located elsewhere. data_type Character string. data type uploading. One : "new_tags" (default), "receivers", "detections", "events", "gps", "glider". print_response Logical. want POST response printed? Mostly useful diagnostic purposes. Default FALSE.

title: Upload files to MATOS — post_file
text: notification success file upload returned.

title: Upload files to MATOS — post_file
text: post_file takes project name number, file want upload, type file want upload (defaulting VRL transmitter detections). data_type "new_tags", "receivers", "glider", CSV XLS/XLSX     files accepted; "detections", VRL CSV files accepted;     "events" "gps", CSV accepted. Multiple files can uploaded , must data type     posted project.

title: Upload files to MATOS — post_file
code: if (FALSE) { # Newly tagged fish, the default post_file(87, 'your_tagged_fish.xls') post_file(87, 'your_tagged_fish.xls', 'new_tags')  # Transmitter detections post_file('umces boem offshore wind energy', 'c:/wherever/your_CSV_detections.csv',      'detections') post_file('umces boem offshore wind energy', 'c:/wherever/your_VRL_detections.vrl',      'detections')  # Receiver metadata post_file('umces boem offshore wind energy', 'your_receiver_metadata.xlsx', 'receivers') }

what: Search for tags on the MATOS website — tag_search
title: Search for tags on the MATOS website — tag_search
text: function interface MATOS' tag search page, result CSV downloaded working directory. aware: downloads can take *long* time, especially many tags searching long period time.

title: Search for tags on the MATOS website — tag_search
code: tag_search(tags, start_date, end_date, import = F)

title: Search for tags on the MATOS website — tag_search
text: tags Character vector tags. coerced CSV POSTing website. start_date Character string listing start date MM/DD/YYYY format. dates provided, tag detections returned. end_date Character string listing end date MM/DD/YYYY format. dates provided, tag detections returned. import downloaded data imported R data frame? Default FALSE.

title: Search for tags on the MATOS website — tag_search
code: if (FALSE) { tag_search(tags = paste0('A69-1601-254', seq(60, 90, 1)),            start_date = '03/01/2016',            end_date = '04/01/2016') }

what: Internal functions used by matos — utilities
title: Internal functions used by matos — utilities
text: Non-exported utility functions used functions matos.

title: Internal functions used by matos — utilities
code: get_file_list(project_number, data_type)  get_project_number(project)  get_project_name(project)  html_table_to_df(html_file_list)  login_check(url = "https://matos.asascience.com/report/submit")  scrape_file_urls(html_file_list)

title: Internal functions used by matos — utilities
text: project_number Number project data_type one "dataextractionfiles" "projectfiles". project Character string full MATOS project name. big name bold top project page, "Project Title" . coerced lower case, capitalization matter. html_file_list Listed files HTML form. Always result get_file_list url (protected) URL overlapping function trying call.

title: Internal functions used by matos — utilities
text: get_file_list scrapes HTML associated project data extraction files page provided given project. get_project_number finds internal MATOS number associated project scraping HTML main MATOS projects page. get_project_name finds MATOS project name associated given project number scraping HTML main MATOS projects page. html_table_to_df converts HTML table provided get_file_list R-usable data frame. login_check pings protected URLs calls matos_login referred login page. scrape_file_urls used internally html_table_to_df extract URLs associates "Download" link.
